body.p:
Office of Chief of Police,
Louisville, Ky., Decr -- 21st 1860
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of Kentucky --

On the day of in the City Court of Louisville I was fined Five Hundred Dollars because of a charge of dealing Faro and immediately I proceeded to pay the per cent. costs & commissions which amounted to one Sixhundred sixty three dolls -- ($163.) -- The balance remains unpaid -- A Capias pro fine has been issued agasint me and shall be under the necessity of paying or suffering imprisonment --

I think it a great hardship to pay this fine -- The times are very hard now And Money is exceedingly scarce with every body -- Five hundred Dollars is a large Amount to raise when times are Flush; but now
it is absolutely impossible to raise it --
You are aware, Governor, that I am a Cripple -- I might perhaps make other arrangements but for this fact -- I pray your Excy -- therefore to remit this fine --

With great respect I remain your friend and obedient servant --
J Vaughn
We the undersigned having read the foregoing petition of Johnson Vaughn and being personally acquainted with him Cheefully recommend a remission of his fine --

Lovell H Rouseau
Silas F. Miller
A. Throckmorton
T L Crittenden
G B Bate
I know Mr Vaughan the Petitioner he is a cripple & I am satisfied he is unable to pay the fine & believe it should be remitted
N B I am in hope that the Governor in granting me this favor will grant it fully -- That he will remit not respite this fine --

Louisville City Ct
$500 } Faro
J. Vaughan
Issd Jany 21 1861
